intro: Gerbera nivea, commonly known as the white gerbera, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers with white petals and a yellow center. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and prefers well-drained soil and full sun. Its foliage consists of lance-shaped leaves that are usually green and slightly hairy. Gerbera nivea is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and floral arrangements.
